action.action-desc: Mr. Meuser introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to exempt off-exchange secondary trading from State regulation where such trading is with respect to securities of an issuer that makes publicly available certain current information, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Restoring the Secondary Trading Market Act.
Section 18(a) of the Securities Act of 1933 (15 U.S.C. 77r(b)(4)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking or at the end;
in paragraph (3), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; or; and
by adding at the end the following:
shall directly or indirectly prohibit, limit, or impose any conditions upon the off-exchange secondary trading in securities of an issuer that makes current information publicly available, including—

subparagraph.text: the information required in the periodic and current reports described under paragraph (b) of section 230.257 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations; or
the documents and information specified in paragraph (b) of section 15c2–11 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations.
